name: Te Anau Kiwi Holiday Park

reviews.title: Great value, comfy stay and huge bathroom
reviews.text: Stayed here while in Te Anau for 3 nights. We had the cabin room. It has 1 queen bed and 1 single bed. A basic kitchennete with all the basic ammenities for some simple cooking, clean pots and pans, cups and wine glasses, and milk given upon check in. The bathroom has a heater and is huge and really clean. The rooms just nicely sized for 2-3 people and we could just park our rented car right in front. A walk away from town and supermarket where we bought Bluff oysters and wine. Really nice place to relax. Staff was helpful and friendly

I absolutely loved this place. Not just because the facilities were great, modern and very comfortable but because of the exceptional service I`ve received from the owners Anna and Brad. They went out of their way to accommodate and help me! Anna even turned the heater on for me before I`ve arrived and my room was nice and cosy warm. I have never experienced such fantastic customer service before. Thank you so much Brad and Anna for looking after me, I`m looking forward to my next visit.
reviews.title: Best customer service ever!!!

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way to Doubtful Sound, Our room was warm and lovely and had everthing we needed. The owners were very hospitable and showed us all the amenities. You can hire a house, with linen without linen, with bathroom, without bathroom.
reviews.title: accommodation for every type of person

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you need to cook youcan go to the big kitchen where you can hire all the utensils ( a thing that is common know in NZ, because of light fingered tourists)
reviews.title: great value

reviews.text: We had some oysters still in the shells that we had just got in Stewart Island, and the owner even gave us his special knife and glove for opening them.
reviews.title: nice place~

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights at Te Anau Great Lakes Kiwi Holiday Park with a campervan on a powered site. Lovely site, very clean and well-equipped. Allocated sites on large, grassy plots with wooden tables/benches. Large, comfortable and very clean washrooms. Spacious, well-equipped and clean kitchen/dining area and lounge/computer room. Nicely tended, landscaped gardens and neat surfaced driveways. Just a few minutes walk to the town centre with lots of shops and eateries. Just a short walk to Lake Te Anau with some of the most beautiful scenery in New Zealand. The best town to stay for a day excursion to Milford Sound. All buses seem to stop here for pick-ups on the way from Queenstown to Milford.
reviews.title: Good campsite in a lovely area and best-placed for Milford

reviews.text: It rained for almost two days without stopping while we were in Te Anau so we were happy that our motel unit was comfortable and provided everything that we needed. The location close to town was excellent so we could walk down the main street to the Lake and was close to restaurants and shops etc. The hosts were very helpful and provided us with information about the activities available. The holiday park ran bbq which was good value for dinner one night and movies for the kids in the lounge area. The open fire was welcoming (even on the 1st January) when it was unseasonably cold. The wireless internet was a bit touchy and we needed to go closer to the reception area to get faster access. We would certainly return to Te Anau Kiwi Holiday Park and hope that it does not rain next time so that we can do our Milford Sound Cruise.
reviews.title: Rain rain rain

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night and no shadow at all like most places while it was extremely sunny. Places are very small, you can see both neighbours if you have both windows open and read what they have in their hands. Showers are good and enough available. Kitchen is not so good, they have warm water and you can sit there to eat easely. But in the kitchen there is only a place to cook, but without anything. Nothing to do the dishes with, nothing to cook with, you can rent that for 5 dollar at the reception.
reviews.title: Small places most without shadow, good shower, bad kitchen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That is not something I expect from a kiwi camping. Not cooking everyday, but did it over there and had to take everything out of my camper to be able to do that. That is a bit of a disappointment.
reviews.title: Hospitality not so high

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Camping is almost in town, with is not an advantage, other kiwi camping in town is next to the lake, which give a better view in the morning and in the evening.
reviews.title: Great Value..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this holiday park purely from a monetary point of view.
reviews.title: Disappointed...

reviews.text: We booked a basic cabin which I was told would have no bedding, we were fine with this as we had our own anyway. We were over the moon to find we had a bathroom in the cabin. After travelling around the whole of NZ on a tight budget I was tired of having to walk to the toilet in the middle of the night. Unfortunately however, we found the toilet door was locked and in order to have it unlocked we'd have to pay extra, not just a little extra either! Absolutely disgraceful in my opinion. The toilet was there in the room, it wasn't being used and in order to squeeze the last little penny out of their customers they keep it locked unless you cough up the cash. Shocking and frustrating.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.

reviews.text: Another thing that really brings this place down is the fact that they have no crockery, cutlery or cooking utensils whatsoever available to guests, unless of course you're again, willing to pay extra! I stayed on various camp sites across NZ and this was the first time we did not have any kitchen wares available to us. I wasn't the only guest horrified by this and you found that while in the kitchen guests were loaning each other what they had so that they didn't to pay to hire things from the site staff.
reviews.title: Acceptable basic accommodation, centrally located. A little noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are several other examples similar to above but I have only listed those that annoyed me the most.
reviews.title: Delux Cabin

reviews.text: It's a real shame that this was the case as the camp site is one of the nicest I stayed at. It was clean and very well located, across the road from the town center and the supermarket. If it wasn't for this, I'd have given the place only one star!
reviews.title: Fab bathroom!!

reviews.text: I have used Great Lakes for the last 2 years, and will do every time I'm in Te Anau, which is at least annually. The only disappointment was being charged $5 for leaving a bag there when I was returning for a further night.
reviews.title: Great Lakes, great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a pleasant en-suite room with nice comfortable beds, TV etc. The site was nice and quiet and there was car parking right outside the unit. The staff were helpful and friendly. The kitchen was immaculate, but as seemed typical at Kiwi establishments you have to borrow all utensils and pans from reception. The dining area was conveniently next to the kitchen.
reviews.title: A reasonable choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main walkway went past the front of all the units, so privacy was slightly compromised, and it was wooden so kids running on it made it bounce.
reviews.title: very good tidy good kitchen and unit.

reviews.text: The Park is just outside the centre of town; you have to walk the length of the main shopping street to get to the lake. However a plus point is that there are restaurants, take-aways, and a good supermarket just a few hundred metres away.
reviews.title: value for money & lots of privacy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good room tidy comfortable kitchen modern and cleen good lounge big tv recommend this park.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced accommodation in good location within the town

aka: Te Anau Kiwi Holiday Park Fiordland
description: With great proximity to town, we’re a great base for exploring the Fiordlands and Milford Sound. We have campervan and caravan sites, tent sites, standard and deluxe cabins, ensuite units and studio motels. Enjoy the TV lounge with log fire and flat screen TV. Laundry facilities are available. An adventure playground is available for children. New shower and toilets with heating. Boat and car parking. Tramper storage. Free information and tour booking office. Winter rates apply. We look forward to seeing you at our Fiordland Holiday Park!
